text: The 2016 Rugby World Women's Sevens Olympic Repechage Tournament was a qualification tournament for the women's rugby sevens 2016 Summer Olympics which was held on 25–26 June 2016. Olympic qualification tournamentsOlympic sevens qualification explained The tournament used a round-robin format, with the top team qualifying directly to the Olympics. The tournament took place at the UCD Bowl in Dublin, Ireland. == Teams == {| class="wikitable" width=900 |- ! width=41%|Means of qualification !! width=17%|Completed date !! width=16%|Venue !! width=5%|Berths !! width=21%|Qualified |- | rowspan="2"|2015 CONSUR Women's Sevens || rowspan="2"| 7 June 2015 || rowspan="2" | Santa Fe || rowspan="2" align=center| 2 || |- | |- | rowspan="2"|2015 NACRA Women's Sevens || rowspan="2"| 14 June 2015 || rowspan="2" | Cary || rowspan="2" align=center| 2 || |- | |- | 2015 Rugby Europe Women's Sevens Grand Prix || 21 June 2015 || Various ||align=center| 1 || |- | rowspan="3"|2015 Rugby Europe Women's Sevens Repechage || rowspan="3"| 19 July 2015 || rowspan="3" | Lisbon || rowspan="3" align=center| 3 || |- | |- | |- | rowspan="3"|2015 Women's Africa Cup Sevens || rowspan="3"| 27 September 2015 || rowspan="3" | Johannesburg || rowspan="3" align=center| 3 || |- | |- | |- | rowspan="2"|2015 FORU Women's Sevens Championships || rowspan="2"| 15 November 2015 || rowspan="2" | Auckland || rowspan="2" align=center| 2 || |- | |- | rowspan="3"|2015 ARFU Women's Sevens Championships || rowspan="3"| 29 November 2015 || rowspan="3" | Various || rowspan="3" align=center| 3 || |- | |- | |- ! colspan=3|Total !! 16 !! |} 1\. Kenya, as the runners-up in the African qualifying tournament, would have qualified to this tournament, but instead qualified directly for the Olympics after South Africa withdrew.Kenya women replace South Africa for Rio Madagascar, the fifth-place finisher in qualifying, was named as a replacement.South Africa reject Olympic invitation ==Pool stage== ===Pool A=== {| class="wikitable"
